programme.title: Les ambassadeurs
programme.desc: Tourism by train A veritable tribute to the train! Armelle discovers the various deals offered by the SNCB for tourists, visits one of the world's most beautiful stations and, in the company of a true railway enthusiast, explores line 43 Liège-Marche-en-Famenne, along a route that combines travelling by train, bike and foot. Presented by: Armelle.

programme.title: En route vers les sommets
programme.desc: Setting their sights high The team divides into two rope parties according to each person's preferences. Over five days, they will climb different peaks: the north Xuelian for some and the west Xuelian for others. They embark on the most demanding climb of their lives. Director: Martin Schilt (season 2, Switzerland, 2021)

programme.title: Version Française
programme.desc:
A visit to the Cognacq-Jay Museum, home to the 18th century artworks collected by Ernest Cognacq and Marie-Louise Jay. Interior designer Bruno Borrione advocates an uninhibited style using materials with character. Glenn Martens brings a fresh look to the Jean Paul Gaultier fashion house. All the expertise of Peruke.
Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: 5 chefs dans ma cuisine
programme.sub-title: Croustade aux pommes et aux courges
programme.desc: Apple and squash croustade Blake Mackay prepares a croustade that combines squash and apple to perfection. And to ensure nothing goes to waste, the apple skins and core are used to create home-made vinegar. Presented by: Marina Orsini. Directed by: Nicole Dussault, David Gauthier, Stéphane Rocheleau, Léo Boulanger (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Nos maisons
programme.desc: Bungalow Built to house families after the baby-boom, Quebec's bungalows are typical of the suburbs, each with their rectangular layout, basement and carport. Directed by: Mathieu Baer (Canada, 2019)

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of a familiar yet little-known Paris monument, the Petit Palais. Between porcelain and jewellery, Alix D.Reynis reinvents jewellery inspired by history. Paris on film, in the footsteps of Amélie Poulain. Focus on Ateliers Baudin where Jurassic tradition takes on contemporary style with bespoke eyewear in horn frames. Presented by: Katherina Marx

programme.title: #chicenVF
programme.desc: The plastic artist Éva Jospin takes us on an expedition through the heart of her cardboard forests and other contemporary works. The Middle Ages seem so very far away? Focus on a technique inherited from the period: illumination. Commentary: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: The Loire-Atlantique, from Guérande to the Côte de Jade We head for Nantes, proud capital of a region brimming with creativity, before visiting Guérande with its rich mediaeval past and salt marshes. Our journey then continues in the surprising Brière before coming to an end at Pornic as we discover a picturesque fishing harbour and elegant seaside villas. Directed by: Chloé Chovin (season 4, France, 2017)

programme.title: Échappées belles
programme.desc: Delicious Lille Lying on the crossroads where Picardie meets Belgium, Lille offers a wealth of culture and rich history. Its architecture is an open book to its fascinating past. Its proximity to seemingly endless beaches naturally attracts tourists. And its gastronomy, ignored for so long, today gets the top billing it deserves. Presented by: Sophie Jovillard. Directed by: Jean-Yves Cauchard (season 15, France, 2020)

programme.title: Histoire(s) de jardins
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc:
Season 7, episode 2:

Spotlight on bread by the Poilâne family. The swimsuit: a story studded with scandal. In his Parisian workshop at the Viaduc des Arts, Philippe Atienza reveals the craft of the boot-maker to the public gaze. How to wear a long necklace. The portrait of eyewear manufacturer Amaury Cagniard, master craftsman.

Commentary by: Viviane Blassel.

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
programme.desc: The sandwich challenge Forget the crustless sandwich as we bring you a world of sandwiches redesigned by Samir Benzeguir, alias Capitain Sandwich. We sample Montréal's best banh mi and a gluten-free special by K pour Katrine. Presenter : Christian Bégin.

programme.title: Alice Guy, l'inconnue du 7ème art
programme.desc:
Who has heard of Alice Guy (1873-1968)? The name of this Frenchwoman was erased from the history of cinema, even before her death. A thousand films, a career that spanned both sides of the Atlantic, she was the first woman director, scriptwriter, producer and studio director. Portrait of a pioneer.

Directed by: Nathalie Masduraud, Valérie Urrea (France, 2021)

Narrated by: Agnès Jaoui, Maud Wyler.

programme.title: Les nouveaux nomades
programme.desc: Sophie explores Pays Toy, in the Pyrenees. When talking about Saint-Nazaire it's usually industry and shipbuilding that come to mind. But recently the town has placed greater emphasis on its coastline. Éric heads behind the scenes in the Cussac Cave. Yvan goes mushroom picking in a somewhat unusual spot. Presented by: Sophie Jovillard, Julie Hattu, Éric Perrin, Yvan Hallouin.

programme.title: Épicerie fine, terroirs gourmands
programme.desc: The Côte d'Albâtre The Côte d'Albâtre, on the Channel coast of Normandy. Baptiste Lemonier opens the doors to his dairy farm, the Bois-des-Saules. Gladys Heude, market-gardener in Cauville-sur-Mer, takes us to pick herbs and edible flowers. Cyriaque Lethuillier shares his love for the cliffs of Étretat. Focus on the history of the herring. Presented by: Guy Martin.

programme.title: Ça roule en cuisine
programme.desc: "Jardins by La Cloche" Sophie Menut is in Dijon, Burgundy. She has an appointment with Aurélien Mauny, the chef of "Jardins by La Cloche", a restaurant in the Grand Hôtel La Cloche, where he serves a decidedly bistronomic menu. Presentation: Sophie Menut.

programme.title: La recette de Guy Martin
programme.desc: Rolled chicken with truffles, green apples and confit lemon The Michelin-starred chef Guy Martin presents products emblematic of France and suggests a recipe to prepare them. Presented by: Guy Martin.

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: The Loire-Atlantique, from Guérande to the Côte de Jade We head for Nantes, proud capital of a region brimming with creativity, before visiting Guérande with its rich mediaeval past and salt marshes. Our journey then continues in the surprising Brière before coming to an end at Pornic as we discover a picturesque fishing harbour and elegant seaside villas. Directed by: Chloé Chovin (season 4, France, 2017)

Its proximity to seemingly endless beaches naturally attracts tourists. And its gastronomy, ignored for so long, today gets the top billing it deserves. Presented by: Sophie Jovillard. Directed by: Jean-Yves Cauchard (season 15, France, 2020)

programme.title: La recette de Guy Martin
programme.sub-title: Selle d'agneau des prés salés farcie aux herbes
programme.desc: Saddle of salt-meadow lamb with herb-stuffing The Michelin-starred chef Guy Martin presents products emblematic of France and suggests a recipe to prepare them. Presented by: Guy Martin.
